key_responsibilities: focused on education, labor, and financial services, but will also include tax, budget, trade, and judiciary, among other issues
spearhead the Congresswoman’s Future of Work Caucus
requirements: good knowledge of the legislative process, coalition building, and have the ability to maintain strategic relationships with constituent organizations
ability to advance the Congresswoman’s legislative priorities in their issue portfolio and be creative in spotting new legislative opportunities
self-starters, able to meet short deadlines, and juggle many priorities in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: staffing HHS Appropriations Committee hearings
developing and advancing a proactive legislative agenda on poverty and economic justice
drafting and analyzing legislation
writing policy memos and talking points
working with outside stakeholders
meeting with constituents
requirements: excellent writers
thorough understanding of the Appropriations process
experience working on healthcare policy and economic/racial equity issues

key_responsibilities: running the front office
managing the DC internship program
assisting with member correspondence
managing tour and flag requests
providing general office support to the administrative team
other special projects as assigned
requirements: excellent oral and written communication skills
patience in challenging situations
demonstrated ability to take initiative and work independently

key_responsibilities: managing all aspects of the Congressman’s daily and long-term schedule in D.C., the District and elsewhere
coordinating and implementing all administrative functions of the D.C. office including constituent requests and records management

Hawai’i background

initiative, strong interpersonal skills, the ability to multitask, work independently and effectively under pressure, make decisions and solve problems, orientation to detail, excellent verbal communication and writing skills

key_responsibilities: monitors and updates the Strategic Initiatives Director and team on district and local issues
acts as a liaison to federal, district, and local agencies for the Congressman and constituents
answers casework correspondence and verbal communications with constituents
requirements: motivated, organized, and sociable
comfortable working with the public
excellent oral and written communication skills
bachelor’s degree in the related field of human services or social work
minimum of three years relevant experience in community or human services

office: The Energy and Commerce Committee Democratic Staff
key_responsibilities: drafting news releases, social media posts, op-eds and talking points
designing graphics for both social media and web content
monitoring social media for trending topics
maintaining and updating press lists
compiling daily press clips

proven ability to perform under pressure while juggling multiple tasks
sound political judgment

office: The House Office of Diversity and Inclusion
key_responsibilities: leading data and research collection and analysis for the Office of Diversity and Inclusion
leading the development of the required diversity report
maintaining key metrics and key performance indicators for the Office
serving as a resource for external and internal diversity best practices

serving as the project manager for any consultants and/or contractors with whom the Office may engage to support the completion of the diversity report and to develop relevant diversity and inclusion-based training, in collaboration with the Congressional Staff Academy
requirements: Master’s degree in social or behavioral sciences or related field; or equivalent level of experience providing technical assistance, data collections and/or research
knowledge and experience in diversity, equity, and inclusion research efforts, ideally with a strong background in curriculum development
Current working knowledge of coalition functioning, evaluation and research
Quantitative and qualitative evaluation and research skills
Expertise using relevant software
Customer-service orientation and ability to work harmoniously with a diverse team
Ability to work under deadline pressure and extra hours if needed on assignment
Demonstrated ability to self-motivate, initiate project activities, and work on multiple assignments simultaneously
Extensive computer skills, including data input

key_responsibilities: drafting legislation
writing hearing statements and legislative memos
preparing briefing materials

solid grasp of House procedures and a deep understanding of relevant policy
Excellent writing, verbal and organizational skills
ability to be a self-starter while working in a fast-paced environment
